evidence.text:
Person B: Brazilian Bar Association. Can you put the coffee on?
Person A: Sure, Mrs. Paiva. Want me to fix you dinner?

Person A: I'm a bundle of nerves, Mrs. Paiva, my hand won't stop shaking. 
Person B: Stay calm. You take care of the kids, and I'll deal with these men.

Person A: Yes. She said you were coming back with Rubens. 
Person B: How is she?
Person A: She's never at home anymore. Always out playing volleyball.
Person B: And the little ones?
Person A: Shaken up.

Person B: What about Vera? Have you heard from her?
Person A: She called the other day... I told her you'd gone to São Paulo.

Person A: Nalu's in your bed. Since you've been gone, she only sleeps there.
Person B: Sweetie. C'mere.

Person A: Mr. Machado's out front. Should I put some coffee on?
Person B: I'll pick the kids up at school. Just taker care of lunch, please.

Person A: Your apron's frayed. I told you should buy a new one.
Person B: The cash ran out, so I had to use the money Mr. Paiva gave me to buy groceries while you were away. There wasn't enough for a new one. 
Person A: Of course. I'll go by the bank tomorrow and get us some more cash.
Person B: And... Mrs. Paiva, could you see about my pay, too? I know you've got an awful lot on your plate, but Mr. Paiva only paid me through December.
Person A: I'm sorry Zezé, I'll sort it out.
